# Escape Sequences

## Backslash Escapes

These characters can be escaped:

\\ backslash itself
\` backtick \* asterisk
\_ underscore
\{ curly brace open
\} curly brace close
\[ square bracket open
\] square bracket close
\( parenthesis open
\) parenthesis close
\# hash mark
\+ plus sign
\- minus sign
\. dot
\! exclamation mark

## Escaping Emphasis

This should show literal asterisks: \*not italic\*

This should show literal underscores: \_not italic\_

This should show: \*\*not bold\*\*

## Escaping in Context

You can write about \*emphasis\* without triggering it.

To show a literal \`backtick\` inline.

Escaping a \[link\](http://example.com) so it doesn't render.

## Mixed Escaped and Real

Here is _real italic_ and \*escaped asterisks\*.

Here is **real bold** and \*\*escaped stars\*\*.

## Numbers and Periods

1986\. What a great season.

Without escape: 1986. This becomes a list.

## Special Cases

AT\&T should show ampersand.

4 \< 5 should show less-than.

Use \> for blockquote character.
